qas.question: How much energy do electric motors use in the modern United States?
In what domain did electric motors reduce reliance on humans and animals?
Besides shafts, belts and compressed air, what did electric motors reduce the need for?
Where did electric motors improve convenience and safety?
How much energy do electric motors use in the modern UK?
In what domain did electric motors not reduce reliance on humans and animals?
Besides shafts, belts and compressed air, what didn't electric motors reduce the need for?
Where didn't electric motors improve convenience and safety?

context: Application of electric motors revolutionized industry. Industrial processes were no longer limited by power transmission using line shafts, belts, compressed air or <a2_0><b6_0>hydraulic pressure<b6_0/><a2_0/>. Instead every machine could be equipped with its own electric motor, providing easy control at the point of use, and improving power transmission efficiency. Electric motors applied in <a1_0><b5_0>agriculture<b5_0/><a1_0/> eliminated human and animal muscle power from such tasks as handling grain or pumping water. Household uses of electric motors reduced heavy labor <a3_0><b7_0>in the home<b7_0/><a3_0/> and made higher standards of convenience, comfort and safety possible. Today, electric motors stand for <a0_0><b4_0>more than half<b4_0/><a0_0/> of the electric energy consumption in the US.
